oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Church of the Lord Jesus service, 1995 September 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Hood, Ralph W.; Williamson, W. Paul (William Paul)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Video recording opening with singing and dancing. The twirling dance indicative of the Jolo church in in evidence as many members of the congregation dance. The film cuts and begins again with the congregation still engaged in song and dance, but with several members handling serpents.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Appalachian Region, Southern--Religious life and customs; Dance--Religious aspects; Singing--Religious aspects; Snake cults (Holiness churches)--Appalachian Region, Southern
Elkins, Barbara; McCoy, Tim; Porter, Carl
Church of the Lord Jesus (Jolo, W. Va.)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Church of the Lord Jesus recordings and photographs
Ralph W. Hood and W. Paul Williamson field recordings, interviews, and photographs
